title: Where Coal Is King, Candidates Must Tread Carefully
teaser: Kentucky's coal industry is on the decline, but it’s risky for a politician to express lukewarm feelings about the industry’s future.
contentencoded:
As Kentucky’s two U.S. Senate candidates joust to prove their loyalty to coal, one gubernatorial candidate has found himself in political trouble over the same issue.

From the Here & Now Contributors Network, Erica Peterson of WFPL takes a look at the oversized role the fossil fuel continues to play in the commonwealth’s elections.

  • Read more on this story via WFPL

Reporter

  • Erica Peterson, environmental reporter for WFPL in Louisville, Ky. She tweets @ericampeterson.
